data.author: Justus Braun
data.message:
Fix Embree4 RTCRay struct initialization (#40)

The raycaster did not find any intersections because embrees ray masking
feature is now enabled by default. The default Geometry ray mask is now
0x1. To make the ray intersect all geometries the RTCRay::mask field
must be set to 0xFFFFFFFF.

data.author: Alexander Mock
data.message:
Remove support for Ubuntu 20 and ROS 1 (#36)

* Fixes for using lvr2 as CMake imported Target and BaseVector matrix multiplication (#34)

* Fix cmake warning in find_package_handle_standard_args

* Fix compilation with PCL and for using lvr2 targets

* Fix PointBuffer constructor would set points as normal data

* Fix matrix multiplication with Eigen::Matrix4 indexing

* Fix race condition in NearestCenterOctreeReduction

* Update the EmbreeRaycaster to use embree4 (#35)

* Upgrade Embree support from 3 to 4

* Remove unsupported ubuntu 20.04 and add libembree-dev to dependencies

---------

Co-authored-by: Justus Braun <45860849+JustusBraun@users.noreply.github.com>

data.author: Justus Braun
data.message:
Fixes for using lvr2 as CMake imported Target and BaseVector matrix multiplication (#34)

* Fix cmake warning in find_package_handle_standard_args

* Fix compilation with PCL and for using lvr2 targets

* Fix PointBuffer constructor would set points as normal data

* Fix matrix multiplication with Eigen::Matrix4 indexing

data.author: Justus Braun
data.message:
Fix leaking spdlog symbols in dynamic library (#32)

The spdlog functions and definitions were public within the lvr2 shared
library which lead to errors when the library is used in a project using
a different version of spdlog e.g. ROS2s rclcpp

data.author: Justus Braun
data.message:
Update spdlog version to v1.15.0 and precompile Logger & Monitor (#31)

* Fix deprecated implicit Copy-Assignment operator in BaseVector

* Fix deprecated function boost::filesystem::extension -> Path::extension

* Fix initialization order, integer signedness and memcpy with non trivial types warnings

* Fix 'this is not a constant expression' error when using fmt::format_to in spdmon

* Bump spdlog version to v1.15.0

* Precompile Logger and Monitor

Implementing the Logger and Monitor functions using the spdlog and
spdmon libraries in a .cpp file removes the need to install spdlog and
spdmon and therefore prevents conflicts with other installations of
these libraries. spdlog::spdlog and spdmon::spdmon can be privately
linked against the lvr2core, lvr2_static and lvr2 targets.

* Mark CMakeLists in ext/ compatible with newer CMake versions

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Add `BaseMesh::nextFEVIndex()`

This is, again, mainly useful for iterating over FEVs with
OpenMP. When writing a loop iterating over all possible handles,
you need to know the biggest possible handle. That's what this
method returns.

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Add `containsFEV()` method to BaseMesh

This is particular useful for OpenMP usage. Of course, it's nice
to use the `mesh.vertices()` iterator, but OpenMP can't make
a parallel for loop out of that. Thus, you need to manually iterate
over all vertices by iterating over all possible handles. But you
need to be able to check whether a particular vertex/... exists.
That's what these methods are for.

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Optimize `visitLocalNeighborhoodOfVertex` slightly

Instead of using `HashMap::get()` we use `HashMap::containsKey()`
since the latter one is a bit faster. Maybe we could just use
an `std::unordered_set` in the future...

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Optimize `HashMap::erase()`

This was, only one instead of two lookups are necessary

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Optimize `HashMap::insert()`

It now only needs one lookup instead of three before. It's still not
perfect, but already a lot better.

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Disable `StableVec::checkAccess` in release mode

Sadly, this kind of checking has some runtime overhead.

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Slightly improve local neighborhood search and add visitor

The `calcVertexLocalNeighborhood` is slightly faster now (only
by around 15%). There is also a new method `visitLocalNeighborhoodOfVertex`
which uses a visitor instead of pushing all neighbors onto a vector.
The former function uses the latter.

The visit function is now used in height-diff and roughness
calculations. It hardly improves performance, but makes the code a
bit shorter.

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Fix `calcVertexLocalNeighborhood`: avoid duplicate neighbors

Before, many vertices were pushed multiple times due to a small bug
in the implementation. The `neighborsOut` vector usually contained
somewhere from twice to thrice as many elements as necessary, meaning
that every vertex handle in this vector was (on average) two or three
times in that vector.

This changes has two effects:
- The result of `calcVertexRoughness` is slightly different! As this
  function averages over a value attached to each vertex, having some
  vertices multiple times or only once makes a difference. However,
  this difference isn't huge. Apart from that, I think that the new
  value is the correct one while the old one was incorrect due to
  said bug.
- Since functions using `calcVertexLocalNeighborhood` get a smaller
  vector now, those functions are faster. My unscientific benchmark
  shows an improvement of around 80% (e.g. 16s --> 9,5s).

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Improve `calcVertexLocalNeighborhood()` slightly

The function was improved by using a better suited method from
`BaseMesh`. This way we avoid some unnecessary heap allocations
which improves performance a bit. A very unscientific benchmark
shows that the new version of `calcVertexHeightDiff` is twice
as fast.

These changes do not change any results of those algorithms.

Materializer will generate materials (and textures, if enabled) for each face in the form of a FaceMap<Material>.
When using textures, the materializer will be handed a texturizer that is used to generate textures for each face
that fits the specified limits (min/max size of clusters for example).

data.author: Juan Hernando Vieites
data.message:
Do not throw from ~Object

Triggers a warning in new compilers and it's not recommended because
it can cause double exceptions during stack unwinding.
In C++11 destructors are implicitly noexcept, so std::terminate will be
called unless noexcept(false) (C++11 only syntax) is added.

Improve Meap interface to more closely match `AttributeMap`

Note: we can't implement the `AttributeMap` interface directly,
because it contains a `get()` method returning a mutable reference
to the value. If we would allow that, the user might change the
value without the Meap knowning. This would lead to a corrupted
heap.

data.author: Lukas Kalbertodt
data.message:
Add `BaseMesh` interface and move `Handle` types to said interface

The handle types have to be visible to the interface already as
some methods of the interface use those types. The `Handle` types
have been extended, too. There are also `OptionalHandle` types
which are semantically equivalent to `optional<Handle>`, but more
memory efficient.

This is very much WIP!

Port lvr_viewer and qglviewer to Qt5

At least I think it's fine now. The lvr_viewer's 3D navigation
with the mouse is a bit strange on my PC, but I don't know if it
has been the same before.

Generally, I didn't test this too much. This is the first version
without anything obviously wrong. It compiles and doesn't really
result in any warnings.

Someone should take a look at all my changes. I think there is
still some work to be done, but a big part is finished now.

data.author: Michael G√∂rner
data.message:
collect installation include dirs of the separate projects

These will be added to lvrConfig.cmake later on.
Adding them to the INTERFACE of the library targets
as implemented before fails to capture header-only libraries.
INTERFACE libraries could be used to resolve this,
but wouldn't leave a way to use only the lvr headers
(without the library). Also adding "proper" interfaces
to the libs requires to transform every find_packaged
external dependency into a target with proper interfaces.
Most configs do not provide these yet.

data.author: Michael G√∂rner
data.message:
first generation of a lvrConfig.cmake

Basically, this supports everything required, *except*
for exporting -DLVR_* definitions.

Probably, the most clean solution for defs is to add
a generated config.h to the distributions instead of
passing the variables by compile flags.

Otherwise, they could also be exported via the
INTERFACE_COMPILE_DEFINITIONS properties.

Especially, this also removes the trailing underscore
at the end of _USE_PCL_ - all others didn't have that one.

This change is necessary to allow the constants to be exported
via a cmake config without polluting an importing project's namespace.

data.author: Michael G√∂rner
data.message:
change `#include "A/X.hpp"` to `#include <lvr/A/X.hpp>` in headers

Actually `#include "../A/X.hpp"` is the preferred way to include here,
but gcc doesn't shorten such include pathes and stacks them recursively
e.g. including "lvr/reconstruction/../geometry/../io/../io/PointBuffer.hpp"

In theory this is no problem, but in practice
(1.) it becomes harder to read error messages
(2.) Windows has rather short file path limits and this mechanism is known
to produce compile failures on Windows because of the increased path length.

Headers in the same section are included via `#include "X.hpp"` to
keep the sections as self-contained as possible and reduce file lookups.

data.author: Simon Herkenhoff
data.message:
Introduces further changes to classification.

- Default classifier now is PlaneSimpsons
- HalfEdgeMesh::finalize() will generate region buffers for
  NormalClassifier only.
- reconstruct has a new option "-w" / "--writeClassificationResult" to
  dump classification results via Classifier::writeMetaInfo().

data.author: Simon Herkenhoff
data.message:
changes to IndoorNormalClassifier

The IndoorNormalClassifier should as of now always be part of the
internal meshing pipeline. All faces are now colored in standard
lightgrey. Instead of coloring, the IndoorNormalClassifier now creates
for each region a string "label" being one of "horizontalupper",
"horizontallower", "vertical" or "unknown". In further steps, these
region labels can be evalutated.

since it only needs the information stored in BaseMesh's buffers.

data.author: Thomas Wiemann
data.message:
Renamed MCReconstruction to FastReconstruction

The plan is to implement two grind versions: The fast and linked
version that is currently implemented and capable of parallel
reconstruction and a recursive and memory efficient one that will
probably not support parallel processing.

data.author: Thomas Wiemann
data.message:
Renamed MCReconstruction to FastReconstruction

The plan is to implement two grind versions: The fast and linked
version that is currently implemented and capable of parallel
reconstruction and a recursive and memory efficient one that will
probably not support parallel processing.

data.author: Thomas Wiemann
data.message:
Sereral new features added

- Vertex class now has []-access for writing values
- Introduced standard exceptions to vertex class
- StannPointCloudManager now calculates a bounding box
- Changned member acces in BoundingBox class from .x etc. to []
  access. Class now should work with every type that has indexed
  access
- Removed center point in MCReconstruction (now uses BBox)

data.author: Thomas Wiemann
data.message:
Found binary read / write bug in PLYIO

The sizeof() operator always returns "4" for template parameters. Hence
only ply files that were exported with the PLYIO class were read and
written correctly. Will now remove the template argumentes from the
property classes and parse the type sizes manually.
